task_name: teach my parent to use video calls
task_description: Task to teach my parent to use video calls

must_have: I'm not really sure what's important
nice_to_have: Explore accessibility features that might help them during video calls
Offer to join them on their first few calls for support and reassurance
Include tips on etiquette during video calls, such as muting when not speaking
Incorporate fun backgrounds or filters to make video calls more engaging
deal_breakers: They don't have a reliable internet connection.
They prefer traditional phone calls over video calls.

decision_factors: Availability of devices with video call capability
Need for regular communication with family

technical: A device that can do video calls, I think it needs to be modern or something
Good performance, but I'm not sure what that means exactly
Internet speed, maybe something fast but not too fast? I heard that's important
non_technical: They should feel comfortable, but I don't know how to gauge that
Maybe some sort of fun aspect to it? Like games during calls, but not sure how
I think they should get used to it quickly, but it's hard to say what that means

must_meet: They have to be able to make a call but I don't know how to measure that
I think they need to see the other person clearly, whatever that takes
should_meet: It would be good if they could also receive calls, but I canâ€™t tell if they will
I hope they find it easy enough, but I'm not sure what 'easy' really is
nice_to_meet: I guess having fun features like filters would be nice, but I'm not sure if that's necessary
If they could learn some basic etiquette, that would be good too, but I'm unsure how to teach it

metadata.task: teach my parent to use video calls
